column4: guys .. im having a huge problem with my laptop. i was trying to setup afterstep on ubuntu 9.04, and after i get all the packages installed, i run this command echo "export WINDOW_MANAGER=/usr/local/bin/afterstep" > ~/.gnomerc
now the laptop crashs everytime i boot
erm, isn't afterstep in the repositories?  Why did you compile it?
http://pastebin.com/m3f5f6c5d
well it shouldn't be in /usr/local/
yes i know, i found that in a guide, and i changed to the right path after look for afterstep with whereis
but that's not what you wrote.  What does your ~/.gnomerc actually say?
what else did you run?
try setting WINDOW_MANAGER to metacity the same way you set it to afterstep
sorry,
no.. this didnt work
pastebin your .gnomerc
describe what you mean by "crash" exactly
after it boots, as usual ubuntu loads the graphic login. it refreshs the screen like... 3 times, and laptop crashs, nothing works, no numlock, nothing
so you never attempt to login?
and ... i cant see anything only fuzz graphics..
no.. i cant display that screen
pastebin /var/log/Xorg.0.log
hmm... im using a PC next to the laptop, will take some time to get the log from there in here
im goin to try mount a usb drive
here is the Xorg.0.log http://pastebin.com/m60bbcd93
do you know if the (EE) line in your log is normal for you?
i got no idea, actually, Xorg.0.log looks alot bigger compared to slackware
well, theres got to be something wrong with my xorg.conf. i started Xorg, and it happens the same, it crashes
